resources.string: By default, messages are sent with normal priority. This optimizes the client app\'s battery consumption (Doze). There may be a short delay in receiving the notification. With high priority the notification can wake a sleeping device and is received immediately.

Indication of how much of the user\'s valuable attention should be consumed by this notification. Low-priority notifications may be hidden from the user in certain situations, while the user might be interrupted for a higher-priority notification. The system sets a notification\'s priority based on various factors including the setPriority value. The effect may differ slightly on different platforms.
This App allows you to test whether or not Push Notifications are working on your phone and network. It will perform a series of checks and will give you feedback if one of the steps fails.
To start the test please click the button on the bottom.
Your phone can receive push notifications without any problems.
Step 1 will check whether all prerequisites for receiving push notifications are met.
You can now request a push notification to be sent to your device. If you want to test the behaviour after your device goes to sleep you can delay the sending of the notification on the server.
Step 3 will request a push notification from the server and will check whether your device can receive it properly.

© 2016 by Bernd Bindreiter.

Find this App on GitHub: https://github.com/bbindreiter/PushNotificationTester_App
